message:
When I see the tour video in this product homepage, I feel that the .NET world is so fragmented. See how things like BDD-tests, feature-branches, DB-migrations, environment-configuration (dev, prod, ..), and more ... are just seemly integrated together.
It's not just a tool thing I believe, sure, the IDE makes it much easier, but the defined (obviously opinionated) process is there, and looks pretty mature. I'm officially impressed.
name: Ruby on Rails IDE :: JetBrains RubyMine
caption: www.jetbrains.com
description: The most intelligent Ruby on Rails IDE with rails code refactorings and code completion

data.message: no man this is in ruby on rails you assign the names of the production db, testing and staging and depend on the environment it load the required resources. actually you can code ruby on rails in VIM or from the terminal not like .NET

That's why I said I said it's not just a tool thing. I'm here embracing the ecosystem. It's just this video is the best I saw in explaining the entire ecosystem in one go that is both simple, and not very demo-blah.
